com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui

Class GuiCheckController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.GuiCheckController

  • public class GuiCheckController
extends Object
    The class GuiCheckController is a core component of the Acrolinx GUI SDK. It is used to control the work and information flow. You can use a GuiCheckController for checks, corrections dialog checks, inline checks, storage and configuration.

      • checkText

        public void checkText(ShowOptionsStrategy showOptionsStrategy,
             ShowResultStrategy showResultStrategy,
             String text,
             CheckCallback callback)
        Checks the text. The check result is passed to the given callback as soon as the check is finished.
        Parameters:
        showOptionsStrategy - see ShowOptionsStrategy
        showResultStrategy - see ShowResultStrategy
        text - the text to check
        callback - provides a callback to get the check result as soon as the check is finished, see CheckCallback

      • check

        public void check(ShowOptionsStrategy showOptionsStrategy,
         ShowResultStrategy showResultStrategy,
         PrepareCheckCallback unSavePrepareCheckCallback,
         CheckCallback checkCallback)
        Check checks the Document provided by PrepareCheckCallback.
        Parameters:
        showOptionsStrategy - see ShowOptionsStrategy
        showResultStrategy - see ShowResultStrategy
        unSavePrepareCheckCallback - see PrepareCheckCallback. You do not have to care to be in the right GUI thread. This will be done automatically by TaskManager.
        checkCallback - see CheckCallback

        public void check(ShowOptionsStrategy showOptionsStrategy,
         ShowResultStrategy showResultStrategy,
         PrepareCheckCallback unSavePrepareCheckCallback,

        Parameters:
        showOptionsStrategy - see ShowOptionsStrategy
        showResultStrategy - see ShowResultStrategy
        unsafePrepareCheckCallback - see PrepareCheckCallback. You do not have to care to be in the right GUI thread. This will be done automatically by TaskManager.
        checkCallback - see CheckCallback

      • showOptions

        public void showOptions()
        Shows options dialog.

      • showOptionsWithExtractionMarkingButton

        public void showOptionsWithExtractionMarkingButton(PrepareCheckCallback unsavePrepareCheckCallback,
                                          InlineCheckCallback inlineCheckCallback)
        Shows the options dialog. The extraction marking button will be enabled and if the button is clicked an extraction check will be performed.
        See also: CheckType.FLAG_EXTRACTION
        Parameters:
        unsavePrepareCheckCallback - The PrepareCheckCallback which will be used to extract the text if an extraction check is performed.
        inlineCheckCallback - The InlineCheckCallback which will be used to mark extracted text if an extraction check is performed.

      • getOptionDialogCallback

        public OptionDialogCallback getOptionDialogCallback()
        Returns:
        a OptionDialogCallback which saves settings, updates localizer, and configures logging

      • checkWithCorrectionDialog

        public void checkWithCorrectionDialog(ShowOptionsStrategy showOptionsStrategy,
                             ShowResultStrategy showResultStrategy,
                             PrepareCheckCallback unSavePrepareCheckCallback,
                             CorrectionDialogCheckCallback correctionDialogCheckCallback)
        Check with corrections dialog.
        Parameters:
        showOptionsStrategy - see ShowOptionsStrategy
        showResultStrategy - see ShowResultStrategy
        unSavePrepareCheckCallback - see PrepareCheckCallback. You do not have to care about running in the right GUI thread. This will be done via TaskManager.
        correctionDialogCheckCallback - see CorrectionDialogCheckCallback

        Gets the settings from stores opening a progress dialog. note:If you only want to get the GUI locale at startup use getLocalizer().getLocale() instead to prevent establishing a connection to server.
